title: Grounded Persuasive Language Generation for Automated Marketing
author: Jibang Wu (University of Chicago), Chenghao Yang (University of Chicago), Simon Mahns, Chaoqi Wang, Hao Zhu (Stanford University), Fei Fang (Carnegie Mellon University), Haifeng Xu..., Simon Mahns
relevance_why: This paper explores the application of Large Language Models (LLMs) in generating persuasive content, a technique that could enhance the personalization and engagement of audio-related marketing strategies in Haohe Liu's research.
background: The paper develops an AI-driven framework to automate the creation of persuasive marketing content, focusing on real estate listings while ensuring factual accuracy and alignment with user preferences.
contribution: This paper introduces an agentic framework for grounded persuasive language generation to address the challenges in automated marketing, achieving higher persuasiveness compared to traditional methods.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods often lacked personalization and grounding in factual data, leading to less effective marketing content.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work employs a triadic module approach (Grounding, Personalization, Marketing) that ensures accuracy and relevance in generated content.

key_innovation: The use of an LLM-based agent with dedicated modules to mimic human expertise in feature selection and content personalization provides a unique and scalable approach to automated marketing.
real_world_impact: Potentially revolutionizes automated marketing in real estate and other sectors, improving engagement rates and consumer trust through responsible and targeted communication.
limitations: No major limitations were specifically mentioned, but the complexity of the model could pose challenges in scaling across other domains.

new_terms.grounded persuasion: **Grounded persuasion** refers to a type of persuasion based on factual information and tailored to the audience's preferences and context.
new_terms.agentic framework: **Agentic framework** indicates a structured system designed to operate autonomously in generating targeted communications.
